And there is MR there, you can clearly see Aegis.

I've chunked ADC's for 90% of their HP or more as a fed {{champion:101}} with two spells.

For reference, the Anivia had full build (and was up 2 levels on Ashe) - {{item:3135}} {{item:3040}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3027}}  {{item:3089}} {{item:3151}} (725 AP from just these items)

Ashe had a total of 52 MR (counting locket, easier to see in the video), which became 34 MR after {{item:3135}} , which became 4 MR after {{item:3020}} {{item:3151}} , which became -12 MR after runes and masteries. 

Yes, Ashe had *negative* 12 MR.

% Damage Dealt with negative MR = 2 - (100/(100 - MR)) = 2 - (100/(100 + 12)) = 1.10% damage

Ashe had 1576 HP, so lets look at some mages that could delete her with 2 spells + Thunderlords (266 damage in this case) having that much AP:

* {{champion:143}} -Q+E



Note that with none of the champions on that list did I use a single Ultimate. These are basic ability combos that would kill that Ashe just as fast. I also skipped a few, and I'm sure there are other off-meta picks that could do it too (AP Jarvan could almost do it).

Good point, but magic pen CANNOT reduce MR below 0. Only MR reduction can, a few such as {{champion:32}} and {{champion:9}} passive and items {{item:3001}} {{item:3091}} can reduce below 0 but rarely happens because reduction is applied BEFORE penetration.
So in your calculations Ashe should be taking damage as if she had 0 MR (100% pseudo true dmg), not -12. Not a huge difference, just thought I should get that out there.

Fiddlesticks no longer has a magic resistance reduction passive. Ever since the recent mage update, his passive has been changed to giving him movement speed for a few seconds whenever he stands sill (either due to doing nothing or due to channeling his W)
